September 2021: In Eastern region, an unidentified group attacked a primary school and boarding house for orphaned children. The perpetrators beat the security guards, forcefully entered the school, and ordered everyone to leave. They also beat and attempted to rape at least one female teacher. 15 individuals were later arrested by the police. The perpetrators were allegedly contracted by a local politician who is involved in a litigation procedure after refusing to step down from his role in the school. He stated the following day that the arrested individuals were attempting to do some work for him inside the school before they were arrested.
Weapon Carried/Used: No Information on the Weapon Used

December 2020: 334 students were abducted and taken to a rainforest by gunmen who stormed the all-boys secondary school. A security guard was killed in the attack. In response, the provincial government ordered the closure of all schools across the state until further notice. Many students escaped or were released days later. Students reported being beaten during captivity and deprived of food and water. At least two students were reportedly killed. Boko Haram claimed responsibility for the attack, but government authorities disputed that claim, and attributed the attack to a Fulani gang instead.

November 2020: A university training centre was stormed by three gunmen, throwing grenades and firing bullets in classrooms, over six hours. One perpetrator reportedly detonated his suicide vest at the start of the attack. Around 15,000 people were on campus at the time, most of which managed to escape. At least 20 students and lecturers were held hostage in classrooms. Afghan security forces and US troops arrived and engaged in a gunfight, eventually killing the gunmen. 18 students and four teachers were killed during the raid. Classes resumed two days later. After ten days, the Afghan Government arrested the organiser of the attack: a recruit of the Haqqani network.
